meanings.sent1: After receiving feedback, she decided to readdress her presentation to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent2: Please readdress the envelope with the correct recipient's name and address.
meanings.sent3: He tried to readdress his mistake by apologizing and offering to help fix it.
meanings.sent4: The team needed to readdress their strategy after realizing it was not effective.
meanings.sent5: In order to improve, it's important to readdress areas where you may be struggling.

meanings.definition: To redirect mail to a new address
meanings.sent1: The post office will readdress the package to the new location as requested.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to readdress your subscriptions when you move to a new house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to readdress the mail to its own secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to readdress her life, just like the mail that gets sent to the wrong place.
meanings.sent5: The old letter was readdressed and finally reached its intended recipient after years of being lost.
